column2: U.S. judge weighs penalties after Bank of America fraud verdict NEW YORK
column3: Dec 5 A U.S. judge is considering an alternative that could result in Bank of America Corp  paying much less than the $863.6 million the government is seeking as a penalty for the sale of defective mortgages before the financial crisis.
